ygData.subject: Re: Estate of Unrest
ygData.msgSnippet: Even as a dark elf it is easy... Follow the right zone barrier as high up as you can go and you will be safe from guards,,, then in Dagnors swim all the way to
ygData.messageBody:
Even as a dark elf it is easy... Follow the right zone barrier as high up as
you can go and you will be safe from guards,,, then in Dagnors swim all the
way to the unrest cave area... You'll get arount them all without invis
even... That is unless some idiot has trained the guards to the zone


>From: TkAdam@...
>Reply-To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com
>To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] Estate of Unrest
>Date: Wed, 21 Jul 1999 11:46:16 EDT
>
>From: TkAdam@...
>
>In a message dated 7/20/99 6:42:28 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
>AshcroftJT@... writes:
>
> > << I was planning a trip to Unrest tonight and was wondering if anyone
>had
> > any info on it that may be useful. Is it decent for a lvl 23 to solo?
>I
> > heard that there's usually alot of people there, so the risk of
>getting
>hit
> > by more than one MOB is low. Also, is there anywhere in Faydwer for a
>DE
>to
> > sell? As an outcast I was pretty sure there wasn't..... >>
> >
> >
> > Unrest is not a solo spot you'll do alot better getting in a
>group.....as
> > for
> > selling try the druid ring in BB near the crossroads (hard to find you
>may
> > want to look at a map first )> No where to bank though so 2 days is
>max
> > I
> > could stay without heading home to neriak.
> >
>
>As a Dark Elf Necro... I would not even advise going there. EVERY guard,
>and
>NPC (especially the druids mentioned above) will be KOS. It will be a
>harowing trip. If you make it though, it ids a good place to learn :)
>
>Sonoroud Tomebinder.
